description: Enterprise techniques used by APT33, ATT&CK group G0064 v1.0
name: APT33 (G0064)

techniques.comment: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used kill dates in their malware to guardrail execution.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used password spraying to gain access to target systems.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used port 443 for command and control.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a publicly available exploit for CVE-2017-0213 to escalate privileges on a local system.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used AES for encryption of command and control traffic.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used base64 to encode payloads.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used base64 to encode command and control traffic.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has created a scheduled task to execute a .vbe file multiple times a day.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used ports 808 and 880 for command and control.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used FTP to exfiltrate files (separately from the C2 channel).
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used HTTP for command and control.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has deployed a tool known as DarkComet to the Startup folder of a victim.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has utilized PowerShell to download files from the C2 server and run various scripts.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has downloaded additional files and programs from its C2 server.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used WinRAR to compress data prior to exfil.

[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a variety of publicly available tools like [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349), [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002), Gpppassword, SniffPass, and ProcDump to dump credentials.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used SniffPass to collect credentials by sniffing network traffic.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has attempted to exploit a known vulnerability in WinRAR (CVE-2018-20250).
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has lured users to click links to malicious HTML applications delivered via spearphishing emails.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has sent spearphishing emails containing links to .hta files.
[APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used valid accounts for initial access and privilege escalation.
